     343             :       //
     344             :       // - INACTIVE, ACTIVE_REQUESTED, INACTIVE_REQUESTED, INACTIVE

     348             :       // Therefore, the if and else branches here aren't always interleaved.
     349             :       // This is ok because the JS engine can handle that.

     351         120 :       if (mJSSampling.compareExchange(ACTIVE_REQUESTED, ACTIVE)) {

     418             : public:
     419             :   // The list of active checkpoints.
     420             :   js::ProfileEntry volatile mStack[1024];
     421             : 
     422             : private:
     423             :   // A list of pending markers that must be moved to the circular buffer.
     424             :   ProfilerSignalSafeLinkedList<ProfilerMarker> mPendingMarkers;
     425             : 
     426             :   // This may exceed the length of mStack, so instead use the stackSize() method
     427             :   // to determine the number of valid samples in mStack.
     428             :   mozilla::sig_safe_t mStackPointer;
     429             : 
     430             :   // mSleep tracks whether the thread is sleeping, and if so, whether it has
     431             :   // been previously observed. This is used for an optimization: in some cases,
     432             :   // when a thread is asleep, we duplicate the previous sample, which is
     433             :   // cheaper than taking a new sample.
     434             :   //
     435             :   // mSleep is atomic because it is accessed from multiple threads.
     436             :   //
     437             :   // - It is written only by this thread, via setSleeping() and setAwake().
     438             :   //
     439             :   // - It is read by SamplerThread::Run().
     440             :   //
     441             :   // There are two cases where racing between threads can cause an issue.
     442             :   //
     443             :   // - If CanDuplicateLastSampleDueToSleep() returns false but that result is
     444             :   //   invalidated before being acted upon, we will take a full sample
     445             :   //   unnecessarily. This is additional work but won't cause any correctness
     446             :   //   issues. (In actual fact, this case is impossible. In order to go from
     447             :   //   CanDuplicateLastSampleDueToSleep() returning false to it returning true
     448             :   //   requires an intermediate call to it in order for mSleep to go from
     449             :   //   SLEEPING_NOT_OBSERVED to SLEEPING_OBSERVED.)
     450             :   //
     451             :   // - If CanDuplicateLastSampleDueToSleep() returns true but that result is
     452             :   //   invalidated before being acted upon -- i.e. the thread wakes up before
     453             :   //   DuplicateLastSample() is called -- we will duplicate the previous
     454             :   //   sample. This is inaccurate, but only slightly... we will effectively
     455             :   //   treat the thread as having slept a tiny bit longer than it really did.
     456             :   //
     457             :   // This latter inaccuracy could be avoided by moving the
     458             :   // CanDuplicateLastSampleDueToSleep() check within the thread-freezing code,
     459             :   // e.g. the section where Tick() is called. But that would reduce the
     460             :   // effectiveness of the optimization because more code would have to be run
     461             :   // before we can tell that duplication is allowed.
     462             :   //
     463             :   static const int AWAKE = 0;
     464             :   static const int SLEEPING_NOT_OBSERVED = 1;
     465             :   static const int SLEEPING_OBSERVED = 2;
     466             :   mozilla::Atomic<int> mSleep;
     467             : 
     468             : public:
     469             :   // If this is a JS thread, this is its JSContext, which is required for any
     470             :   // JS sampling.
     471             :   JSContext* mContext;
     472             : 
     473             : private:
     474             :   // The profiler needs to start and stop JS sampling of JS threads at various
     475             :   // times. However, the JS engine can only do the required actions on the
     476             :   // JS thread itself ("on-thread"), not from another thread ("off-thread").
     477             :   // Therefore, we have the following two-step process.
     478             :   //
     479             :   // - The profiler requests (on-thread or off-thread) that the JS sampling be
     480             :   //   started/stopped, by changing mJSSampling to the appropriate REQUESTED
     481             :   //   state.
     482             :   //
     483             :   // - The relevant JS thread polls (on-thread) for changes to mJSSampling.
     484             :   //   When it sees a REQUESTED state, it performs the appropriate actions to
     485             :   //   actually start/stop JS sampling, and changes mJSSampling out of the
     486             :   //   REQUESTED state.
     487             :   //
     488             :   // The state machine is as follows.
     489             :   //
     490             :   //             INACTIVE --> ACTIVE_REQUESTED
     491             :   //                  ^       ^ |
     492             :   //                  |     _/  |
     493             :   //                  |   _/    |
     494             :   //                  |  /      |
     495             :   //                  | v       v
     496             :   //   INACTIVE_REQUESTED <-- ACTIVE
     497             :   //
     498             :   // The polling is done in the following two ways.
     499             :   //
     500             :   // - Via the interrupt callback mechanism; the JS thread must call
     501             :   //   profiler_js_interrupt_callback() from its own interrupt callback.
     502             :   //   This is how sampling must be started/stopped for threads where the
     503             :   //   request was made off-thread.
     504             :   //
     505             :   // - When {start,stop}JSSampling() is called on-thread, we can immediately
     506             :   //   follow it with a pollJSSampling() call to avoid the delay between the
     507             :   //   two steps. Likewise, setJSContext() calls pollJSSampling().
     508             :   //
     509             :   // One non-obvious thing about all this: these JS sampling requests are made
     510             :   // on all threads, even non-JS threads. mContext needs to also be set (via
     511             :   // setJSContext(), which can only happen for JS threads) for any JS sampling
     512             :   // to actually happen.
     513             :   //
     514             :   static const int INACTIVE = 0;
     515             :   static const int ACTIVE_REQUESTED = 1;
     516             :   static const int ACTIVE = 2;
     517             :   static const int INACTIVE_REQUESTED = 3;
     518             :   mozilla::Atomic<int> mJSSampling;
     519             : };
     520             : 
     521             : #endif

Generated by: LCOV version 1.10
